items.sentence: I\'m usually in pretty good shape, but now I\'m a little overweight.
I\'ve been studying French for a long time, but I\'m not yet fluent.
I\'ve just started to learn French, so I\'m not very good at it yet.
Tom always worries about things that don\'t really matter very much.
Tom can\'t be in the car more than ten minutes without getting sick.
Tom could tell by Mary\'s accent that she was probably from Ireland.
I\'d like to be able to tell Tom that he has nothing to worry about.
I wouldn\'t have sung that song if I\'d known it would make Tom cry.
Tom told Mary not to waste her time trying to convince John to help.
She bought him a camera that was too big to fit in his shirt pocket.
The translation of the French novel took him more than three months.
We cut down the largest tree we could find so we could make a canoe.
We were supposed to tell everyone to be here by 2:30, but we forgot.
What matters in life is not where you are, but where you are headed.
When I was in Boston someone broke into my room and stole my wallet.
Tom can\'t afford all the stuff Mary wants him to buy on his salary.
I wish I could tell you all the details, but my boss told me not to.
She had never seen New York before, so I offered to show her around.
I see no reason why you shouldn\'t ask Tom to go to Boston with you.
If you wish to speak to Tom, you\'ll need to wait about three hours.
